snippet: The governing body for soccer in North and Central America and the Caribbean is proposing changes in areas such as term limits for its top officials.
abstract: Concacaf, regional governing body that oversees soccer in North America, Central America and the Caribbean, lays out number of proposed changes to way it is governed; changes, which were motivated by FIFA scandal, include term limits for top officials and publication of top officers' salaries and other compensation.
lead_paragraph: The governing body for soccer in North and Central America and the Caribbean is proposing changes in areas such as term limits for its top officials.

headline.main: Concacaf Details Plans for Reforms After Scandal
headline.print_headline: Concacaf Details Plans for Reforms After Scandal

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
